# title

**Instance Property**

The title displayed next to a checkbox-style switch.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var title: String? { get set }
```

## Discussion

Set [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UISwitch/title] only when the user interface idiom is [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIUserInterfaceIdiom/mac]; otherwise, a runtime exception occurs.

```swift
let showFavoritesAtTop = UISwitch()
showFavoritesAtTop.preferredStyle = .checkbox
if traitCollection.userInterfaceIdiom == .mac {
    showFavoritesAtTop.title = "Always show favorite recipes at the top"
}
```

The switch ignores [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UISwitch/title] when the value of [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UISwitch/style-swift.property] isn’t [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UISwitch/Style-swift.enum/checkbox].

## Setting the display style

- **Displaying a checkbox in your Mac app built with Mac Catalyst**: Present a switch control as a Mac-style checkbox when your app runs in the Mac user interface idiom.
- **preferredStyle**: The preferred display style for the switch.
- **style**: The display style for the switch.
- **UISwitch.Style**: Styles that determine the appearance of the switch.
